title: Package Metadata Schema
description: Schema defines a JSON structure that accurately represents the package metadata for use with OCI Packaging Format.

id.description: The id field is a unique identifier of the package. Typically, this is represented in a reverse domain notation.

version.description: The version is a user readable string that represents the version of the package. Typically, this is represented in SemVer format.

title.description: User readable string that represents the title of the package.

icons.description: Array of icon files within the package.

src.description: The path to the image file, relative to the package root.

type.description: The MIME type of the image (e.g., 'image/png').

entrypoint.description: Path to the entry point within the package.

dependencies.description: Dependencies are specified with a package name to version range. The version range is a string which has one or more space-separated descriptors. Dependencies can also be identified with a tarball, digest, tag or git URL.

items.description: Capability string in revers domain notation
